Summary of issues so far:
- Network is still unhealthy
- Geth bug patched, but yielding some edge cases with CLs

Bugs that need triaging:
- Geth bug where the CL doesn't switch back to the "correct fork" and hence stalling. Lh/Grandine/Nimbus DON'T have this issue. See CL specific issues for more details.
- Geth question of how the state got corrupted in the first place, why did it try to ever sync this bad block chain and why not reorg onto the main one? Check thread for more details 
- Teku failed state transition, why is teku not switching to the canonical chain and requesting the EL to do so as well?
- Prysm "could not update forkchoice justified checkpoint"? Seems that prysm first stops sending FCUs and then on restart crashes with said error
- Erigon, stuck in its own fork and needs triaging as to why

Please use the appropriate threads to keep the main conversation clean.
